conclusion: Determine the time at which the laser beam emerges from the arc surface ABC.
The laser beam will emerge when it strikes the surface at the critical angle for total internal reflection.
The critical angle θc is given by sin θc = 1/n.
The incident angle θ is related to the vertical displacement R by R = r sin(θ).
For the beam to refract out at the critical angle, set θ = θc, thus R = r sin(θc).
The laser beam travels with a uniform speed v along the AC direction.
The time t taken for the beam to travel this distance is given by t = R/v.
Substituting R = r sin(θc), we get t = r sin(θc)/v.
Using sin(θc) = 1/n, the time t becomes t = r/(nv).
The moment when the light emerges is t = rn/(v√(n²-1)).
